Add distance-threshold spatial relations from coordinates

Source: R/add_spatial_relations.R
add_spatial_distance.Rd

Build and register edges between planning units whose Euclidean distance is less than or equal to dmax, based on coordinates. This constructor does not require sf.

Usage

add_spatial_distance(
  x,
  coords = NULL,
  dmax,
  name = "default",
  weight_fn = c("constant", "inverse", "inverse_sq"),
  eps = 1e-09
)

Arguments

x

A data object created with inputData() or inputDataSpatial().

coords

Optional coordinates specification (see add_spatial_knn).

dmax

Numeric. Maximum distance for an edge (must be finite and positive).

name

Character name/key under which to store the relation.

weight_fn

Character. How to convert distance to weight: "constant", "inverse", or "inverse_sq".

eps

Small numeric constant to avoid division by zero when using inverse weights.

Value

Updated data object.

Details

This constructor uses an \(O(n^2)\) distance computation and is therefore best suited to small or moderate numbers of planning units. For large instances, consider add_spatial_knn instead.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
x <- x |> add_spatial_distance(dmax = 1000, name = "within_1km", weight_fn = "constant")
} # }
